conclusion: Loading and unloading are essential components of the logistics process. The speed of the conveyor is adjustable, allowing different speeds to be set for different types of goods. The length of the conveyor is also adjustable, enabling it to extend directly into trailers for operation. Additionally, the height of the conveyor can be adjusted, making it convenient for workers to directly handle goods located at higher positions in the cargo compartment.

If cargo (which can be considered as a particle) is at the same height as the conveyor, the schematic diagram of the conveying process is shown in Figure C. It is known that the length of the conveyor is L1=6 m, and the conveyor moves clockwise at a speed of v0=2 m/s. The kinetic friction coefficient between cargo A and the conveyor is μ1=0.2. Cargo is released from rest at the left end of the conveyor.
Find the acceleration of cargo A when it is just placed on the conveyor and the time it takes to travel from the left end to the right end. (Take g=10 m/s².)
Figure C shows a conveyor belt moving clockwise with cargo placed at the left end. The conveyor belt has a length L1 and moves at a speed v0.

Forces acting on the carton just after it is laid on the belt: Weight mg (vertical, g = 10 m/s²), Normal force N (vertical) – N = mg (belt is horizontal), Kinetic-friction force fk = μ1N = μ1mg (horizontal, toward the right, because the belt slides rightward under the carton).
Horizontal acceleration while it is still slipping a = fk / m = μ1g = 0.20 × 10 = 2 m/s² (to the right)

premise: Initial velocity of the carton (ground–fixed frame): v10 = 0, Belt (and hence the velocity it must reach): v0 = 2 m/s
conclusion: Time to reach belt speed t1 = (v0 – v10)/a = 2 / 2 = 1 s
Distance travelled during the slipping stage s1 = ½ a t1² = ½(2)(1)² = 1 m

premise: Total distance to the right end: L1 = 6 m, s1 = 1 m
conclusion: Remaining distance once it moves together with the belt s2 = L1 – s1 = 6 – 1 = 5 m
Time to cover the remaining distance at the belt speed t2 = s2 / v0 = 5 / 2 = 2.5 s
Total time from left end to right end t = t1 + t2 = 1 + 2.5 = 3.5 s
